report_title: e-Trading Software Developers in the US Industry Report
executive_summary: Revenue for the industry, which includes companies that operate online securities trading websites and other software programs for the securities market, has increased at a CAGR of 2.9% to $11.3 billion, with an increase of 5.9% in 2023 alone. Charles Schwab and Fidelity recorded robust revenue growth as both industrial and individual investors increased their use of online trading platforms. Moreover, COVID-19 and the rise of individual investors using trading apps are expected to enhance revenue growth moving forward.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Revenue for the e-Trading Software Developers industry expanded at an estimated CAGR of 2.9% to $11.3 billion from 2018 to 2023, including an increase of 5.9% in 2023 alone, as profit reached 28.8%.
The pandemic and subsequent surge in e-trading activity strongly boosted industry revenue; market volatility, higher disposable incomes and bored individuals got into the market.

Inflation uncertainty and the Federal Reserve's increasing interest rates have contributed to tempered revenue growth. High-profile bank failures are also contributing to greater financial uncertainty.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-trading revenue will continue growing from 2023 to 2028
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: E-trading revenue will continue growing from 2023 to 2028, increasing at a CAGR of 2.6% to $12.8 billion.

industry_definition: This industry includes operators that primarily develop independent, third-party software, which enables institutional and retail investors to access, analyze and trade securities electronically.
key_trends: Electronic trading software has benefited from consumers' increased comfortability with online services
Industry software plays a progressively integral role in a highly dynamic financial market system
The industry has consolidated to remain competitive and keep pace with rapid innovation
Investors' ongoing emphasis on data management will likely keep innovation high
Downstream demand from financial institutions will likely continue growing
Industry employment is expected to grow more robustly than the number of enterprises
Industry profit has grown in line with revenue gains over the past five years

market_segmentation.segment_description: Online brokers capture day traders and individual investors.
The institutional investor segment excludes principal transactions undertaken by financial institutions.
Individuals have increasingly comprised a larger share of industry revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Trading platforms allow users to enter and execute trades with a broker manually.
Technical analysis software provides charts of historical exchange rates.
Trading signal generator software provides users the ability to be made aware of the market's level.
High-speed, automated online trading software is expected to account for one-fifth of industry revenue.

tier_1_suppliers: Professional Employer Organizations in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Commodity Dealing and Brokerage in the US
Private Equity, Hedge Funds & Investment Vehicles in the US
Investment Banking & Securities Dealing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: When the economy is doing well, there tends to be higher levels of private investment in computers and software.
The 2008 recession shone a bright light on the lack of transparency and risk protection in financial services industries.
The level of technological change also drives demand for industry products.
The level of market volatility plays a role in the level of trade volume.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The industry doesn't participate in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The West region's share of industry establishments indicates the prominence of California's Silicon Valley region.
New York contains a significant number of e-trading platforms.

regulations_points.regulation_description: A 2023 SEC proposal is expected to bar investment advisers from using non-registered e-trading software.
While not directly regulated, industry operators providing services to financial institutions are examined by the Federal Financial Institution Examination Council under IT guidelines.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Legal restrictions from US government and FINRA
barriers_points.barrier_description: Companies must review dozens of relevant legal restrictions.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Start-up costs range from tiny to enormous
barriers_points.barrier_description: Start-up costs range between tiny and enormous.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is based on the timeliness of processed information provided to customers.
Security is an increasingly important design focus for industry developers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low barriers to entry invite new entrants
concentration_points.concentration_description: The software development industry as a whole is known for its low barriers to entry.
The regulatory split between registered broker-dealers and smaller cryptocurrency-focused trading platforms.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage costs for skilled software developers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor is the major cost for e-trading software development.
Marketing and advertising expenses amount to 3.4% of revenue.
Financial software developers spend a significant portion of their revenue.
The emphasis on R&D and patents leads to frequent legal wrangling.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low capital equipment and machinery costs
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: For every $1.00 spent on wages, operators typically spend $0.05 on capital equipment.
Software can be considered an intangible product.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Wild economic conditions from 2020-2023 created volatile revenue.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Cloud computing has rapidly changed the design of industry software.
Industry software is increasingly scalable and adaptable.

FAQs.question: How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The shift online has greatly benefited industry companies.

FAQs.question: Has technology (i.e. data storage and analytics) affected the type of customers you sell to?
FAQs.answer: Technology has enabled companies to offer a more wide-range of products.
